apple: An apple is a round fruit with smooth green, yellow, or red skin and firm white flesh.
banana: Bananas are long curved fruit with yellow skins.
blueberry: A blueberry is a small dark blue fruit that is found in North America. Blueberries are usually cooked before they are eaten.
coffee: Coffee is a hot drink made with water and ground or powdered coffee beans.
grape: Grapes are small green or dark purple fruit which grow in bunches. Grapes can be eaten raw, used for making wine, or dried.
kiwi fruit: A kiwi fruit is a fruit with a brown hairy skin and green flesh.
lemon: A lemon is a bright yellow fruit with very sour juice. Lemons grow on trees in warm countries.
mango: A mango is a large sweet yellowish fruit which grows on a tree in hot countries.
orange: An orange is a round juicy fruit with a thick, orange coloured skin.
peach: A peach is a soft, round, slightly furry fruit with sweet yellow flesh and pinky-orange skin. Peaches grow in warm countries.
pear: A pear is a sweet, juicy fruit which is narrow near its stalk, and wider and rounded at the bottom. Pears have white flesh and thin green or yellow skin.
strawberry: A strawberry is a small red fruit which is soft and juicy and has tiny yellow seeds on its skin.
watermelon: A watermelon is a large round fruit with green skin, pink flesh, and black seeds.
